refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The aq cat command displays the various plenary templates generated and maintained by the broker.

listitem.para: Generate the plenary template on the fly instead of displaying the on-disk version.
Display the machine plenary. MACHINE may be either the hardware label or the primary host name.
Display the plenary of the named city.

Display plenaries related to the host HOSTNAME. If no other options are specified, then the object template is displayed. If the --data option is specified, then the template storing all the data for the host is displayed. If one of the resource-specific options is specified (e.g. --application, --filesystem etc.), then the named resource is displayed.

Display plenaries related to the cluster CLUSTER. If no other options are specified, then the object template is displayed. If the --data option is specified, then the template storing all the data for the cluster is displayed. If one of the resource-specific options is specified (e.g. --application, --filesystem etc.), then the named resource is displayed.
Hosts and clusters have multiple plenary templates. Specifying this option causes the template containing the data definitions to be displayed.

If this option is specified together with one of the resource options (like --application, --filesystem etc.), then it specifies the resource group where the named resource should be located. If this option is specified without also specifying other resource options, then the plenary template of the resource group will be displayed.

varlistentry.term: --application NAME, --filesystem NAME, --hostlink NAME, --intervention NAME, --reboot_intervention NAME, --reboot_schedule NAME

listitem.para: Display the plenary of the named resource. Use the --resourcegroup if the resource is part of a resource group.

Display plenaries related to the given service. If no other options are specified, then the default top-level plenary is displayed. If --default is specified, then the default client plenary is displayed. If both --default and --server are specified, then the default server plenary is displayed.

Display plenaries related to the given service instance. If no other options are specified, then the default top-level plenary is displayed. If --default is specified, then the default client plenary is displayed. If --server is specified, then the server data, containing all clients of the service, is displayed. If both --server and --default are specified, then the default server plenary is displayed.
Display the server-specific plenaries of a service or service instance. See the description of the --service and --instance options for details.
Display default plenaries which may be overridden by the real templates. See the description of the --service and --instance options for details.
Display the plenary of the given share. Shares are instances of the nas_disk_share instance but contain extra data in the plenaries.

example.title: Look at the object template of a host
Look at the data template of a host
Look at the plenary of a resource group
Look at the plenary of a file system that is part of a resource group
Look at the plenary of a hostlink
Look at the plenary listing the clients of a service instance
